Top Hotel Collections Resorts in Mulshi Camping Resorts 5 Star Hotels View All Hotels In Pune Beautiful Beaches Near Pune Beaches near Pune are aplenty, with people spoilt for choice amidst the many destinations along the Konkan Coast in Maharashtra. The villages of Tarkarli and Alibag are abundant with numerous beaches (Read More), and the white sands of Kashid Beach call out to those lusting for some coastal serenity. Here is the list of 24 Beaches near Pune For A Perfect Weekend Getaway 1. Kashid Beach 4.3 /5 One of the most popular and alluring beaches of Maharashtra, the Kashid beach comes with a promise of a perfect and relaxed beach holiday. The sun-kissed, white, clean sandy beach with crystalline water is full of natural beauty that offers a dream destination for water enthusiasts. The Casuarinas groves, which sway to the tune of the gentle sea breeze, are also in plenty here. Distance from Pune: 172 km Read More 2. Alibag Beach 4.4 /5 View 10+ photos Named after the Alibaug coast, the Alibaug beach is one of the most famous beaches of the city. It is located 2 km from the city center and can be easily accessed by the public transport of the cities. The coastline of the beach runs for 4 km along the shores of the Arabian sea. " Distance from Pune: 143 km Read More 3. Kihim Beach, Alibag 4.1 /5 View 5+ photos Interspersed with dense coconut trees and enveloped with a pollution free green atmosphere, the Kihim Beach is famous for a variety of reasons. Located just 12 kilometres from Alibaug and 120 kilometres away from Mumbai, the proximity of the beach to Mumbai adds to the increasing reputation of the beach. The place boasts of extraordinary beauty and picturesque scenes and is the perfect place for nature lovers to come and relax in the lap of nature, and for photographers to click some fantastic shots. Furthermore, the beach beckons tourists because of its cleanliness and fresh air. Distance from Pune: 144 km Read More 4. Diveagar Beach 4.2 /5 View 8+ photos Diveagar aka Dive Agar is located in, Raigad district of Maharashtra which is near about 170 kms South of Mumbai, is scarsely populated and pretty clean, tidy and peaceful. The area involves abeach, pisces, a temple and local businesses engaged in coconut and bettle nut tree farming. Other involvements comprise of some resort businesses such as restaurants, cottage rentals and Hotels, and six villages. Distance from Pune: 166 km Read More Top Hotels In Pune Search Hotels Best Resorts in Mulshi 15 options from ₹ 2,000 onwards Camping In Pune 3 options from ₹ 2,500 onwards Best Resorts in Pune for a much-needed break! 13 options from ₹ 1,857 onwards Best 5-Star Hotels in Pune 30 options from ₹ 4,090 onwards Hostels In Pune 28 options from ₹ 800 onwards Hotels Near Pune Airport 50 options from ₹ 918 onwards View All Hotels In Pune View All Hotels In Pune 5. Mandwa Beach 4.3 /5 View 5+ photos A popular weekend beach destination from Mumbai city, this beach is situated in the village of Mandwa in Maharashtra. It is very accessible because of the direct ferry services which are available near Mandwa beach to and from Mumbai city. A serene and quaint beach, Mandwa is not going to disappoint you. Distance from Pune: 151 km Read More 6. Dapoli, Maharashtra 4.7 /5 View 6+ photos Known For : Harnai Port Unhavare - Hot springs Panhalakaji Caves Dapoli, situated 215km away from Mumbai is popular tourist destination that serves the needs of all kinds of travelers. It is known as mini-Mahabaleshwar of Maharashtra owing to its cool climate throughout the year. It is located in the Ratnagiri district and is a famous Konkan hill station. Distance from Pune: 185 km Best Time: June to September 14 Dapoli Attractions View Hotels Read More 7. Murud Beach 4.3 /5 Situated in the town of Dapoli, the Murud beach is one of the most happening beaches of the city. Be its scenic views of the surrounding landscape or adventurous water sports; you can find both of these things here. And if you're lucky, you might even have the pleasure of encountering a few friendly dolphins here! Being one of the most popular tourist spots in town, this beach is always thronged with people and is a destination bubbling with activity. Distance from Pune: 180 km Read More 8. Harihareshwar Beach 4.5 /5 A major and popular tourist attraction, Harihareshwar Beach is located close to Shrivardhan in Harihareshwar. The beach is flanked by the Arabian Sea and is famed for its sandy shores and cool atmosphere. Harihara Hill located close by on the sea shore serves as the prime attraction. Another activity that you may indulge in is a boat ride which can be hired easily. Distance from Pune: 177 km Read More 9. Tarkarli Beach, Tarkarli 4.3 /5 View 8+ photos Known for its many beautiful beaches, Tarkarli is an instance of paradise for beach lovers located close enough for a quick weekend trip from Mumbai. With countless beaches such as Tarkarli, Kolam, Achra, one could spend their whole day walking and lazing around and enjoying the various adventurous sports available. What makes the beaches truly magical are the occasional sighting of dolphins. Achra beach also has a 260-year-old Rameshwar temple. Distance from Pune: 389 km Read More 10. Bhatye Beach, Ratnagiri 4.2 /5 View 7+ photos Bhatye is the biggest town in Konkan and one of the immediate suburbs in Ratnagiri with beautiful white sand and bluish water. It gives a beautiful view of the sunset and is an ideal date spot for lovers. It also gives many opportunities for water sports. Distance from Pune: 316 km Read More 11. Ganapatipule Beach 3.4 /5 A clean rocky beach with fine silvery white sand, the Ganapatipule beach, is also known for the lagoon it houses. If you're the adventurous kinds, you can try your hands at balancing a kayak. Distance from Pune: 334 km Read More 12. Kondivili Beach 3.1 /5 Finally a place for adventure seekers, Kondivili Beach famed for such sport activities is situated about 5 km from Shrivardhan Beach. The poplar activities that you can indulge at this beach are paragliding and surfing. Distance from Pune: 165 km Read More 13. Guhagar Beach 4.1 /5 View 9+ photos Located on the banks of the Vashisthi River, the ancient city of Chiplun is famous for Guhagar beach. This pristine location is lies about 42 km away from the main city center of Chiplun. A favorite picnic spot among the locals, Guhagar is popular for its beautiful sunset and peaceful surroundings. Distance from Pune: 242 km Read More 14. Manori Beach 4.2 /5 View 6+ photos Manori, a small village located on Dharavi Bhet in northern Mumbai, is most commonly known for the beautiful Manori Beach and the Manori Creek. If one is looking for a quite, calm and serene beach in Mumbai, then Manori Beach is the place. It is aldo relatively cleaner than the other beaches in Mumbai. Essel World, a well-known amusement park in Mumbai, is located at a very small distance from Manori. Fishing activies also occur frequently at the Beach. Distance from Pune: 190 km Read More 15. Madh Island 3.6 /5 Home to umpteen villages, farmlands and surreal vistas, is the locale of Madh Island in Mumbai. Clustered with quaint fisher villages and dotted with lush green farms, Madh Island is a respite from the glitterati and dazzling environs of the city and can be reached by an hour's drive from the main city. Distance from Pune: 180 km Read More 16. Aksa Beach 3.9 /5 Located a little on the outskirts of the city in Malad, Aksa Beach is an unparalleled oasis for a rejuvenating retreat from the hustle bustle of the city traffic. The mesmerising coastline is one of the longest in the city and offers an extremely vivid and surreal panorama of the merging horizon ahead. Distance from Pune: 175 km Read More 17. Velneshwar, Ratnagiri 3.6 /5 View 8+ photos Situated at a distance of about 35 km from Ganapatipule, Velneshwar is a small village known for its serene, rock-free beach. This little village is flocked by pilgrims to visit the old Shiva temple, especially during the Hindu festival of Mahashivratri, which usually gets marked in the months of February or March. Distance from Pune: 246 km Read More 18. Revdanda Beach 3.2 /5 The ruins of the Portuguese fort are veiled in wild plantations. What stand out are the cannon holes in the fortification walls that border the sea. Even though the fort is now in ruins, the pure historic charm combined with the nature's exotic beauty - the Ravdanda beach - make this a must visit place. Distance from Pune: 172 km Read More 19. Guhagar Beach 4.1 /5 View 9+ photos Located on the banks of the Vashisthi River, the ancient city of Chiplun is famous for Guhagar beach. This pristine location is lies about 42 km away from the main city center of Chiplun. A favorite picnic spot among the locals, Guhagar is popular for its beautiful sunset and peaceful surroundings. Distance from Pune: 242 km Read More 20. Hedvi Beach 3.4 /5 Hedvi beach is situated about 3km from the Ganesh Temple. It is famous because of a rock formation that sits on the beach. Bahman Ghal is a large black monolith of about 35 feet high. Distance from Pune: 245 km Read More 21. Juhu Beach, Mumbai 4.7 /5 View 10+ photos The most popular beach in Mumbai, Juhu beach is located close to Andheri and was once quite a beautiful beach. However, with so many tourists coming in here, the place has become dirty and water is also not clean because of affluents from nearby factories and industries. Distance from Pune: 160 km Tours starting from ₹2,102 Read More 22. Versova Beach 3.8 /5 A continuation of Juhu Beach towards the Andheri suburbs, Versova Beach is comparatively less crowded and only separated by a creek from the former beach. Versova is essentially a fishing village inhabited by Kolis (fisherfolks) situated in the vicinity of the beach, and is a hotbed for fish trade. Distance from Pune: 160 km Read More 23. Marve Beach, Mumbai Away from the industrial pollution and the chaotic city life, Marve Beach is situated in Malad, in the western suburbs of Mumbai. Due to the strong tides and currents, it is generally not recommended to swim in the sea waters or even to step aside post evening hours. Distance from Pune: 174 km Read More 24. Kalamb Beach Located in Nalasopara in Thane district of Maharashtra, is the really long and secluded Kalamb Beach. A paradise away from the din of the city, the beach is beautiful owing to its tranquility, serenity and an altogether mesmerising panorama.
